choices.B: Yes, because the project event-driven controls need to align to program controls.
choices.D: No, because the progress controls should be documented in the project initiation documentation.
choices.A: Yes, because the approach should support the delivery approach selected by the program.
choices.C: No, because the program team should review project progress using peer reviews.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct answer A: 12.3.3

comments.content: Sorry, now I think A is the correct option as reporting approach needs to be in sync with delivery approach and its not mentioned in scenario that a PID exists.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct option as these should already be discussed and recorded in PID. 
A can not be right answer as highlight report is not about delivery approach but instead reporting approach. 
B also is not correct as Highlight report is a time driven control.

Selected Answer: A
The project controls are defined in the PID (option D) but this does not explain whether the proposed approach is correct or not. Instead, looking at ref 4.3.4.5, this is an example of tailoring the project products influenced by programme management.

questions.question_text:
The project is part of a program to increase the number of ABC courses that respond to legislation. The program manager has instructed the project manager to deliver the 'e-learning course' incrementally. The project manager has asked the program manager how often the highlight reports are required, and what format the reports should be presented in.
Is this an appropriate approach to controlling progress, and why?
Starting Up a project is triggered by which of the following?

choices.B: The plan is based on the external outsourcing consultants being available at the start of the initiation stage.
choices.C: The initial project cost estimate of ֲ£2.5m, will have a tolerance of +ֲ£125k Jג€¢ֲ£75k.
choices.A: The Daily Log has been updated with the new risks which were identified while preparing the Initiation Stage Plan.
choices.D: The project management team will consist of representatives from the IT and Facilities Divisions.

questions.question_text: Which statement is an appropriate entry for the Initiation Stage Plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This statement is an appropriate entry for the Initiation Stage Plan. It highlights a critical assumption or dependency related to the availability of external consultants, which is essential information for planning and executing the initiation stage of the project. Assumptions and dependencies are important to consider and document in project plans to ensure that the project proceeds smoothly.

questions.question_text:
During stage 1 the level of performance expected from the service provider was changed.
After this change was agreed which of these products will require updating?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Project Product Description provides detailed information about the characteristics and expected performance of the project's products. If there is a change in the expected performance, this information needs to be updated in the Project Product Description to ensure that it accurately reflects the new requirements and expectations. This is essential for maintaining alignment between project deliverables and customer expectations.

choices.C: Quality Management Strategy because this is where all of the customer's quality expectations of the project's products should be documented.
choices.B: Project Product Description because this contains details of the expected performance of the project's products.
choices.A: Project Brief because this is maintained throughout the project to reflect the customer's quality expectations.
Outsourcing is a growth industry and is being implemented by many private sector organizations.
choices.B: Four other government departments are also considering outsourcing some of their business functions next year.
choices.C: Contracts with service providers should include the timescale within which readiness for service is expected following the transfer of equipment and staff.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer as it has an actionable lesson that can benefit the project.

A) The fact that outsourcing is a growth industry is background context, not an actionable lesson.

B) The plans of other departments don't directly apply as a lesson for this project.

C) Recommending that readiness timescales be included in contracts is a tangible lesson that can inform the project's contracting approach with providers.

Selected Answer: C
This fact is an appropriate lesson for the Outsourcing project. It highlights an important consideration when dealing with outsourcing contracts, specifically the need to define and agree upon timescales for the readiness of services after the transfer of equipment and staff. This lesson can help the project team make more informed decisions and avoid potential issues related to service readiness in the current project.

Selected Answer: B
When collecting lessons in the Capture Previous Lessons activity within the Starting Up a Project process, these can include by whom processes/procedures/techniques were used (ref 14.4.2)

questions.question_text:
While capturing previous lessons, the Project Manager discovered several interesting facts about outsourcing.
Which fact is an appropriate lesson for the Outsourcing project?
